name: 1-(3-methoxybenzoyl)-2-(1-naphthoyl)hydrazine
Reason: 1-(3-methoxybenzoyl)-2-(1-naphthoyl)hydrazine has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The additional functional groups and structural features in 1-(3-methoxybenzoyl)-2-(1-naphthoyl)hydrazine will affect its melting point: (1) The methoxybenzoyl group introduces a rigid structure with increased molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. (2) The naphthoyl group introduces two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion, which would notably augment the melting point. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight.
